Connecting.PleaseWait: Please wait while a connection to the '{{currentlyConnectingTo}}' service is established

Support.Title: Technical Support
Support.SupportText: For support or spare parts, contact us using the information below.

Dashboard.Title: Admin Dashboard
Dashboard.WelcomeMessage: Welcome to the Administrator Dashboard, click on the right hand side to get started.

MachineStatus.Title: Machine Status
MachineStatus.Description: Displays the status of machines managed by PackNet.Server

MachineGroups.Title: Machine Groups
MachineGroups.Description: Displays the machine groups managed by PackNet.Server

CorrugateStatus.Title: Corrugate Status
CorrugateStatus.Description: Displays the status of corrugates managed by PackNet.Server

PickZones.Title: Pick Zones
PickZones.Description: Displays the Pick Zones managed by PackNet.Server

CartonPropertyGroups.Title: Carton Property Groups
CartonPropertyGroups.Description: Displays the Carton Property Groups managed by PackNet.Server

Classifications.Title: Classifications
Classifications.Description: Displays the Classifications managed by PackNet.Server

Top20InvalidRequests.Title: Top 20 Invalid Requests
Top20InvalidRequests.Description: Displays the Top 20 Invalid Requests managed by PackNet.Server

Corrugates.Title: Corrugates
Corrugates.Description: Displays the Corrugates managed by PackNet.Server

ProducibleItemsImported.Title: Producible Items Imported
ProducibleItemsImported.Description: Displays metrics surrounding producible items imported to PackNet.Server

ProducibleItemsCreated.Title: Producible Items Created
ProducibleItemsCreated.Description: Displays the number of items that have been created by PackNet.Server

ProducibleItemsFailed.Title: Producible Items Failed
ProducibleItemsFailed.Description: Displays the number of items that have failed

AverageProductionTime.Title: Average Production Time
AverageProductionTime.Description: Displays the average production time for items that have been created by PackNet.Server

AverageWastePercentage.Title: Average Waste Percentage
AverageWastePercentage.Description: Displays the average waste percentage for items that have been created by PackNet.Server

AverageWastePercentageByMachine.Title: Average Waste Percentage By Machine
AverageWastePercentageByMachine.Description: Displays the average waste percentage by machine for items that have been created by PackNet.Server

AverageWastePercentageByCorrugate.Title: Average Waste Percentage By Corrugate
AverageWastePercentageByCorrugate.Description: Displays the average waste percentage by corrugate for items that have been created by PackNet.Server

CorrugateConsumption.Title: Corrugate Consumption
CorrugateConsumption.Description: Displays the corrugate consumption by corrugate for items that have been created by PackNet.Server

CartonCountByCorrugate.Title: Carton Count By Corrugate
CartonCountByCorrugate.Description: Displays the number of cartons created for each corrugate

CartonCountByMachine.Title: Carton Count By Machine
CartonCountByMachine.Description: Displays the number of cartons created for each machine

CartonCountByUser.Title: Carton Count By User
CartonCountByUser.Description: Displays the number of cartons created for each user

CartonCountByCPG.Title: Carton Count By Carton Property Group
CartonCountByCPG.Description: Displays the number of cartons created per CPG in a production group

ProducibleItemsRotated.Title: Producible Items Rotated
ProducibleItemsRotated.Description: Displays the number of items that have been rotated when created by PackNet.Server

DeleteBoxLastCartons.Title: Delete Box Last Cartons
DeleteBoxLastCartons.Description: Delete all cartons that fall within a date range

Orders.Title: Orders
Orders.Description: Displays a list of Orders in the system

SearchUserNotifications.Title: Search User Notifications
SearchUserNotifications.Description: Search for user notifications by creation date, notification type and severity.

ExpandableRow.NoUsersHaveDismissedThisNotification: No users have dismissed this notification:

ProducibleItemsImportedByDay.Title: Producible Items Imported By Day
ProducibleItemsImportedByDay.Description: Displays metrics surrounding producible items imported to PackNet.Server Daily

ProducibleItemsCreatedByDay.Title: Producible Items Created By Day
ProducibleItemsCreatedByDay.Description: Displays the number of items that have been created by PackNet.Server Daily

ProducibleItemsFailedByDay.Title: Producible Items Failed By Day
ProducibleItemsFailedByDay.Description: Displays the number of items that have failed today

AverageProductionTimeByDay.Title: Average Production Time By Day
AverageProductionTimeByDay.Description: Displays the average production time for items that have been created by PackNet.Server By Day

AverageWastePercentageByDay.Title: Average Waste Percentage By Day
AverageWastePercentageByDay.Description: Displays the average waste percentage for items that have been created by PackNet.Server by Day

AverageWastePercentageByMachineByDay.Title: Average Waste Percentage By Machine By Day
AverageWastePercentageByMachineByDay.Description: Displays the average waste percentage by machine for items that have been created by PackNet.Server By Day

AverageWastePercentageByCorrugateByDay.Title: Average Waste Percentage By Corrugate By Day
AverageWastePercentageByCorrugateByDay.Description: Displays the average waste percentage by corrugate for items that have been created by PackNet.Server By Day

CorrugateConsumptionByDay.Title: Corrugate Consumption By Day
CorrugateConsumptionByDay.Description: Displays the corrugate consumption by corrugate for items that have been created by PackNet.Server By Day

CartonCountByCorrugateByDay.Title: Carton Count By Corrugate By Day
CartonCountByCorrugateByDay.Description: Displays the number of cartons created for each corrugate By Day

CartonCountByMachineByDay.Title: Carton Count By Machine By Day
CartonCountByMachineByDay.Description: Displays the number of cartons created for each machine By Day

CartonCountByUserByDay.Title: Carton Count By User By Day
CartonCountByUserByDay.Description: Displays the number of cartons created for each user By Day

ProducibleItemsRotatedByDay.Title: Producible Items Rotated By Day
ProducibleItemsRotatedByDay.Description: Displays the number of items that have been rotated when created by PackNet.Server By Day

ProducibleItemsImportedByWeek.Title: Producible Items Imported By Week
ProducibleItemsImportedByWeek.Description: Displays metrics surrounding producible items imported to PackNet.Server Weekly

ProducibleItemsCreatedByWeek.Title: Producible Items Created By Week
ProducibleItemsCreatedByWeek.Description: Displays the number of items that have been created by PackNet.Server by week

ProducibleItemsFailedByWeek.Title: Producible Items Failed By Week
ProducibleItemsFailedByWeek.Description: Displays the number of items that have failed this week

AverageProductionTimeByWeek.Title: Average Production Time By Week
AverageProductionTimeByWeek.Description: Displays the average production time for items that have been created by PackNet.Server By Week

AverageWastePercentageByWeek.Title: Average Waste Percentage By Week
AverageWastePercentageByWeek.Description: Displays the average waste percentage for items that have been created by PackNet.Server by Week

AverageWastePercentageByMachineByWeek.Title: Average Waste Percentage By Machine By Week
AverageWastePercentageByMachineByWeek.Description: Displays the average waste percentage by machine for items that have been created by PackNet.Server By Week

AverageWastePercentageByCorrugateByWeek.Title: Average Waste Percentage By Corrugate By Week
AverageWastePercentageByCorrugateByWeek.Description: Displays the average waste percentage by corrugate for items that have been created by PackNet.Server By Week

CorrugateConsumptionByWeek.Title: Corrugate Consumption By Week
CorrugateConsumptionByWeek.Description: Displays the corrugate consumption by corrugate for items that have been created by PackNet.Server By Week

CartonCountByCorrugateByWeek.Title: Carton Count By Corrugate By Week
CartonCountByCorrugateByWeek.Description: Displays the number of cartons created for each corrugate By Week

CartonCountByMachineByWeek.Title: Carton Count By Machine By Week
CartonCountByMachineByWeek.Description: Displays the number of cartons created for each machine By Week

CartonCountByUserByWeek.Title: Carton Count By User By Week
CartonCountByUserByWeek.Description: Displays the number of cartons created for each user By Week

ProducibleItemsRotatedByWeek.Title: Producible Items Rotated By Week
ProducibleItemsRotatedByWeek.Description: Displays the number of items that have been rotated when created by PackNet.Server By Week

GeneralDashboardWalkthrough.Overview: This is the Admin dashboard, where you can setup report widgets to show system statistics. Choose from multiple general, daily, and weekly report widgets for a customized dashboard display. Beyond these standard widgets, Packsize offers additional reporting capabilities. See your Packsize representative for more details!
GeneralDashboardWalkthrough.WidgetDock: This is the area where your report widgets are displayed.
GeneralDashboardWalkthrough.EditDashboard: Select this icon to enable Edit mode. In Edit mode, you can add and remove widgets, change their location on the dashboard, and modify individual widget settings.
GeneralDashboardWalkthrough.AddWidget: Select this icon to add a report widget to the dashboard.
GeneralDashboardWalkthrough.EditDashboardStructure: Select this icon to edit the dashboard structure. You can change the dashboard title, as well as the way your report widgets are laid out.
GeneralDashboardWalkthrough.EditDashboardToSave: When you've finished editing your dashboard, select this icon to save your changes and exit Edit mode.

Articles.Title: Article Management
Articles.DeleteArticlePrompt: Are you sure you want to delete the selected article(s)?

ImportExport.ImportingArticles: Article import started. You will be notified when the import is complete.
ImportExport.UnableToParse: Could not create an export file from the article data.

Validation.CorrugateQualityMustBeNum: Corrugate Quality Must Be A Whole Number

Errors.NoResult: The reply from the server didn't contain any articles.

Intro.Overview: Manage your Articles from this screen.
Intro.NewButton: Select the New button to create a new Article.
Intro.CopyButton: Select an Article from the list, then select the Copy button to copy its information into the new Article screen.
Intro.DeleteButton: Select an Article from the list, then select the Delete button to delete it. <u>Warning! Your selection will be immediately deleted!</u>
Intro.EditButton: Select an Article from the list, then select the Edit button to edit it.
Intro.ProduceButton: Select an Article from the list, then select the Produce button to produce it.

Columns.Overview: Existing Articles are listed here. Select a row to select an Article. Selecting the top check mark will select or de-select all Articles in the list. Selecting a column heading will reorder the list according to that column. Selecting the heading again will reverse the previous order.
Columns.Design: Carton Design Names are listed here.
Columns.Quality: Carton Corrugate Quality is listed here.
Columns.FilterButton: Select the Filter button to display the filter box, then enter the filtering value. The list will be filtered immediately based on your criteria. Select the Filter button again to close the filter box. <u>The list will remain filtered (even if the filter box isn't visible) until the filtering value is removed from the filter box.</u>

Edit.Overview: Create/edit an Article from this screen.
Edit.Design: Select the Design from the drop-down menu.
Edit.MachineType: Select the Machine Type from the drop-down menu.
Edit.SaveButton: Select the Save button to save your changes and return to the Article Management screen.
Edit.CancelButton: Select the Cancel button to cancel <u>without saving your changes</u> and return to the Article Management screen.

Validation.NameRequired: Carton Property Group Name Cannot Be Empty

Intro.Overview: Manage your Carton Property Groups from this screen.
Intro.NewButton: Select the New button to create a new Carton Property Group.
Intro.DeleteButton: Select a Carton Property Group from the list, then select the Delete button to delete it. <u>Warning! Your selection will be immediately deleted!</u>
Intro.EditButton: Select a Carton Property Group from the list, then select the Edit button to edit it.

Edit.Overview: Create/edit a Carton Property Group from this screen.
Edit.Name: Enter/edit the Carton Property Group Name.
Edit.SaveButton: Select the Save button to save your changes and return to the Carton Property Group Management screen.
Edit.CancelButton: Select the Cancel button to cancel <u>without saving your changes</u> and return to the Carton Property Group Management screen.

Columns.Overview: Existing Carton Property Groups are listed here. Select a row to select a Carton Property Group. Selecting the top check mark will select or de-select all Carton Property Groups in the list. Selecting a column heading will reorder the list according to that column. Selecting the heading again will reverse the previous order.
Columns.Alias: Carton Property Group Names are listed here.

Intro.Overview: Manage your Classifications from this screen.
Intro.NewButton: Select the New button to create a new Classification.
Intro.DeleteButton: Select a Classification from the list, then select the Delete button to delete it. <u>Warning! Your selection will be immediately deleted!</u>
Intro.EditButton: Select a Classification from the list, then select the Edit button to edit it.

Edit.Overview: Create/edit a Classification from this screen.
Edit.Name: Enter/edit the Classification Name here.
Edit.SaveButton: Select the Save button to save your changes and return to the Classification Management screen.
Edit.CancelButton: Select the Cancel button to cancel <u>without saving your changes</u> and return to the Classification Management screen.

Columns.Overview: Existing Classifications are listed here. Select a row to select a Classification. Selecting the top check mark will select or de-select all Classifications in the list. Selecting a column heading will reorder the list according to that column. Selecting the heading again will reverse the previous order.
Columns.Name: Classification Names are listed here.

Change.NoLoadedCorrugates: You must have at least one corrugate loaded
Change.CorrugateNotInProductionGroup: Corrugate not loaded in Production Group. Please have an Administrator add Corrugate to the Production Group.
Change.NoCorrugatesLoadedOnMachine: No corrugate loaded for this machine, please update corrugate selection.
Change.IdenticalTracks: Machine {0} has the same corrugate selected on two tracks.  Corrugates must be different.
Change.NoMachines: No machines with tracks exist in Machine Group '{0}'
Change.AtLeastOne: You must have at least one corrugate loaded.

Errors.TrackOutsideOfMachine: Track {1} is outside of the Machine Boundaries of Machine: '{0}'
Errors.IdenticalCorrugate: Track {1} has the same Corrugate on Machine: '{0}'
Errors.OverlappingRubberrollerWithCorrugateLoad: Track {1} is Overlapping the Rubber Roller of another Track, Please unload the affected Track(s) on Machine: '{0}'
Errors.CorrugateTooWideForMachine: The selected Corrugates for Machine: '{0}' are too wide to be loaded on the Machine

Validation.ThicknessMustBeNumber: Corrugate Thickness Must Be A Number
Validation.WidthMustBeNumber: Corrugate Width Must Be A Number

Intro.Overview: Manage your Corrugates from this screen.
Intro.NewButton: Select the New button to create a new Corrugate.
Intro.DeleteButton: Select a Corrugate from the list, then select the Delete button to delete it. <u>Warning! Your selection will be immediately deleted!</u>
Intro.EditButton: Select a Corrugate from the list, then select the Edit button to edit it.

Edit.Overview: Create/edit a Corrugate from this screen.
Edit.Name: Enter/edit the Corrugate Name.
Edit.SaveButton: Select the Save button to save your changes and return to the Corrugate Management screen.
Edit.CancelButton: Select the Cancel button to cancel <u>without saving your changes</u> and return to the Corrugate Management screen.

Columns.Overview: Existing Corrugates are listed here. Select a row to select a Corrugate. Selecting the top check mark will select or de-select all Corrugates in the list. Selecting a column heading will reorder the list according to that column. Selecting the heading again will reverse the previous order.
Columns.Name: Corrugate Names are listed here.

Change.CancelButton: Select the Cancel button to cancel <u>without saving your changes</u> and return to the Machine Production screen.
Change.Overview: Manage the Corrugates for each Machine in the Machine Group here.
Change.PausePlay: Select this button to pause the Machine. Select it again to return the Machine to play mode.
Change.SaveButton: Select the Save button to save your changes and return to the Machine Production screen.
Change.Track: Using the drop-down menu, select the appropriate Corrugate for each track.

ErrorMessages.CreateConveyorFailedAliasExists: Cannot Create a Conveyor with the same Alias as another within this Machine.
ErrorMessages.CreateConveyorFailedIdExists: Cannot Create a Conveyor with an Id that's already persisted.
ErrorMessages.UpdateConveyorFailedDoesNotExist: Cannot Update a Conveyor with an Id that isn't persisted.
ErrorMessages.DeleteConveyorFailedDoesNotExist: Cannot Delete a conveyor with an Id that isn't persisted.
ErrorMessages.UpdateConveyorFailedPickzoneAssigned: Unable to Update Conveyor with selected Pick Zones. One of the Pick Zones is assigned to another Conveyor in this Machine or Machine Group
ErrorMessages.CreateConveyorFailedPickzoneAssigned: Unable to Create Conveyor with selected Pick Zones. One of the Pick Zones is assigned to another Conveyor in this Machine or Machine Group

Edit.CanOnlyAddAccessoriesWhenEditing: You can only add Accessories when editing a machine.

Validation.IpOrDnsNamePattern: Machine's IP address is not in correct format
Validation.SubnetPattern: Machine's Subnet Mask is not in correct format
Validation.DefaultGatewayPattern: Machine's Default Gateway is not in correct format
Validation.ConveyorOneDirectionRequired: At least one Feeding Direction is Required
Validation.ConveyorAllDirectionsNeedPickzone: All enabled directions need a Pick Zone
Validation.ConveyorPickzonesNeedToBeDifferent: The Pick Zones need to  be different
Validation.MachineCreatedFailedAliasExists: A Machine with that Alias already exists. Please choose another Alias.

Intro.Overview: Manage your Machines from this screen. A Machine can be a Packsize Fusion or EM machine, a Zebra printer, a barcode scanner, or an external system.
Intro.NewButton: Select the New button to create a new Machine.
Intro.DeleteButton: Select a Machine from the list, then select the Delete button to delete it. <u>Warning! Your selection will be immediately deleted!</u>
Intro.EditButton: Select a Machine from the list, then select the Edit button to edit it.

Columns.Overview: Existing Machines are listed here. Select the row at the left to select a Machine. Selecting the top check mark will select or de-select all Machines in the list. Selecting a column heading will reorder the list according to that column. Selecting the heading again will reverse the previous order.
Columns.ProductionStatus: Current Production Status is listed here.

Fusion.Overview: Use this screen to create/edit a Fusion Machine. Enter the necessary information and save your changes, or use the Discover button to query the network for existing Machines to add to the system.
Fusion.Name: Enter/edit the Fusion Machine Name.
Fusion.IpOrDnsName: Enter/edit the IP Address. If this is a discovered Machine, other network information may appear. Do not modify any network settings unless instructed to do so.
Fusion.SingleTrack: Select the Single Track button for a single-track Machine.
Fusion.MultipleTrack: Select the Multi Track button for a multi-track Machine.
Fusion.PhysicalMachineSettings: Select the appropriate Physical Machine Settings file from the drop-down menu.
Fusion.SaveButton: Select the Save button to save your changes and return to the Machine Management screen.
Fusion.CancelButton: Select the Cancel button to cancel without saving your changes and return to the Machine Management screen.
Fusion.DiscoverButton: Select the Discover button to query the network for existing Machines.

Em.Overview: Use this screen to create/edit an EM Machine. Enter the necessary information and save your changes, or use the Discover button to query the network for existing Machines to add to the system.
Em.Name: Enter/edit the EM Machine Name.
Em.IpOrDnsName: Enter/edit the IP Address. If this is a discovered Machine, other network information may appear. <u>Do not modify any network settings unless instructed to do so.</u>
Em.PhysicalMachineSettings: Select the appropriate Physical Machine Settings file from the drop-down menu.
Em.SaveButton: Select the Save button to save your changes and return to the Machine Management screen.
Em.CancelButton: Select the Cancel button to cancel <u>without saving your changes</u> and return to the Machine Management screen.
Em.DiscoverButton: Select the Discover button to query the network for existing Machines.

ExternalSystem.Overview: Use this screen to create/edit an External System Machine.
ExternalSystem.Name: Enter/edit the External System Name. The default name in the workflow is External Print Service. If you want to use a different name, talk to your Packsize representative first.
ExternalSystem.Workflow: Select the appropriate Workflow from the drop-down menu.
ExternalSystem.SaveButton: Select the Save button to save your changes and return to the Machine Management screen.
ExternalSystem.CancelButton: Select the Cancel button to cancel <u>without saving your changes</u> and return to the Machine Management screen.

ZebraPrinter.Overview: Use this screen to create/edit a Zebra Printer Machine.
ZebraPrinter.Model: Select the appropriate Printer Model from the drop-down menu.
ZebraPrinter.Name: Enter/edit the Printer Name.
ZebraPrinter.RetryCount: Select/enter the number of times the system should retry connecting to the printer.
ZebraPrinter.PollInterval: Select/enter the time (in milliseconds) the system should wait between communication attempts with the printer.
ZebraPrinter.LabelSecondCheck: Select/enter the time (in milliseconds) the system should wait before checking a second time that the label has printed.
ZebraPrinter.PrinterMode: Select the desired Printer Mode. <u>Peel Off</u> means the printer will advance when the label is peeled off the backing by the operator. <u>Tear Off</u> means the printer will not advance until the label AND its backing are torn off.
ZebraPrinter.PriorityPrinter: Select this checkbox if this is a priority printer.
ZebraPrinter.SaveButton: Select the Save button to save your changes and return to the Machine Management screen.
ZebraPrinter.CancelButton: Select the Cancel button to cancel <u>without saving your changes</u> and return to the Machine Management screen.

Scanner.Overview: Use this screen to create/edit a Barcode Scanner Machine.
Scanner.Name: Enter/edit the Barcode Scanner Name.
Scanner.SaveButton: Select the Save button to save your changes and return to the Machine Management screen.
Scanner.CancelButton: Select the Cancel button to cancel <u>without saving your changes</u> and return to the Machine Management screen.

Conveyor.Overview: Use this screen to create/edit a Conveyor Accessorie.
Conveyor.Name: Enter/edit the Conveyor Name.
Conveyor.RightFeedEnable: This enables/disables the Right Feed functionality of this Conveyor.
Conveyor.LeftFeedEnable: This enables/disables the Left Feed functionality of this Conveyor.
Conveyor.Module: The Module number of the Output Module from left to right on the PLC that this signal cable will be connected to.
Conveyor.Port: The Port of the selected Output Module that the signal cable will be connected to.
Conveyor.PickZone: Select the Pick Zone that this feed will feed the Producible too.
Conveyor.SaveButton: Select the Save button to save your changes and return to the corresponding machines edit page.
Conveyor.CancelButton: Select the Cancel button to discard your changes and return to the corresponding machines edit page.

Discovery.Overview: This screen shows any discovered Machines. Select the Machine you want to add to the system, then select the Save button. This will return you to the New Machine screen, with that Machine's information entered. You can select and add only one discovered Machine at a time.
Discovery.SaveButton: Select the Machine you want to add, then select the Save button to save that Machine's information to the New Machine screen.
Discovery.CancelButton: Select the Cancel button to cancel <u>without saving your changes</u> and return to the Machine Management screen.
Discovery.RefreshButton: Select the Refresh button to re-scan the network for existing Machines.

Columns.Overview: Discovered Machines are listed here. Select a row to select a Machine. Selecting the top check mark will select or de-select all Machines in the list. Selecting a column heading will reorder the list according to that column. Selecting the heading again will reverse the previous order.
Columns.ConfiguredAs: If a Machine is already configured in the system, its name will be listed here.

Intro.Overview: Manage Machine Groups from this screen. A Machine Group usually includes Machines that are next to each other and connected together, such as a Packsize Fusion or EM machine with an attached Zebra printer and/or a barcode scanner.
Intro.NewMachineGroupButton: Select the New button to create a new Machine Group.
Intro.DeleteMachineGroupButton: Select a Machine Group from the list, then select the Delete button to delete it. <u>Warning! Your selection will be immediately deleted!</u>
Intro.EditMachineGroupButton: Select a Machine Group from the list, then select the Edit button to edit it.

Edit.Overview: Create/edit a Machine Group from this screen.
Edit.Name: Enter/edit the Machine Group name.
Edit.WorkflowPath: Select the appropriate Machine Group workflow path from the drop-down menu.
Edit.QueueLength: Select/enter the Machine Group queue length.
Edit.Machines: Select the Machines that will be part of this Machine Group. Click the <u>Show Unavailable Machines</u> link to see which Machines have already been assigned to another Machine Group.
Edit.EffectiveCapabilities: Depending on the machines selected to be part of this Machine Group, their effective capabilities may be listed here.
Edit.SaveButton: Select the Save button to save your changes and return to the Machine Group Management screen.
Edit.CancelButton: Select the Cancel button to cancel <u>without saving your changes</u> and return to the Machine Group Management screen.

Columns.Overview: Existing Machine Groups are listed here. Select a row to select a Machine Group. Selecting the top check mark will select or de-select all Machine Groups in the list. Selecting a column heading will reorder the list according to that column. Selecting the heading again will reverse the previous order.
Columns.ConfiguredMachines: Configured Machines in each Machine Group are listed here.

Change.List: Select the desired Machine Group. This will now be your default.
Change.Overview: Change your Machine Group from this screen.

Console.AutoManual: This sets the Machine Group to either Auto or Manual mode. In Auto mode, the Machine Group accepts jobs from the Production Group. In Manual mode, the Machine Group only accepts jobs input by the Machine Operator.
Console.Capabilities: This lists the capabilities of the Machine Group.
Console.ConfiguredMachines: This lists each configured Machine in the Machine Group, including its current status.
Console.MachineGroup: This shows the current Machine Group.
Console.Overview: Manage the production of your Machine Group from this screen.
Console.PausePlay: This sets the Machine Group to either Pause or Play. Pausing stops new jobs from being sent to the Machine Group. Each Machine in the group will finish producing the work in their queue, then go into Pause mode.
Console.ProductionGroup: This shows the current Production Group feeding work to the Machine Group, as well as the Selection Mode in use.
Console.Status: This shows the current Machine Group status.
Console.User: This shows the current logged-in User.

BoxLast.ShowTriggerInterfaceOnOperatorPanel: Show trigger interface on operator panel
BoxLast.ShowTriggerInterfaceOnOperatorPanelHelp: When selected this will enable an input on the operator panel so that jobs can be triggered by entering the serial number.

Orders.PauseMachineBetweenOrdersHelp: When an order is completed the machine will be put into a paused state prior to starting the next order
Orders.AllowDistributedOrders: Allow orders to be distributed across multiple machine groups
Orders.AllowDistributedOrdersHelp: When enabled, operators can decide to distribute all cartons in an order across all available machine groups in a production group
Orders.DistributeOrdersByDefaultHelp: When checked all orders in this production group will be set to 'distributed' when created

ScanToCreate.ShowTriggerInterfaceOnOperatorPanel: Show trigger interface on operator panel
ScanToCreate.ShowTriggerInterfaceOnOperatorPanelHelp: When selected this will enable an input on the operator panel so that jobs can be triggered by entering the serial number.
ScanToCreate.BarcodeParsingWorkflowRequired: The Barcode Parsing Workflow is required

Intro.Overview: Manage your Production Groups from this screen. Production Groups are logical groupings of Machine Groups. This allows work to be sent to multiple Machine Groups and Machines, increasing speed and efficiency and reducing waste.
Intro.NewButton: Select the New button to create a new Production Group.
Intro.DeleteButton: Select a Production Group from the list, then select the Delete button to delete it. <u>Warning! Your selection will be immediately deleted!</u>
Intro.EditButton: Select a Production Group from the list, then select the Edit button to edit it.

Edit.Overview: Create/edit a Production Group from this screen.
Edit.Name: Enter/edit the Production Group Name.
Edit.ProductionMode: Select the appropriate Production Mode from the drop-down menu.
Edit.MachineGroups: Select the Machine Groups that will be part of this Production Group. Click the <u>Show Unavailable Machine Groups</u> link to see which Machine Groups are already assigned to another Production Group.
Edit.Corrugates: Select the Corrugates that will be used in this Production Group.
Edit.AdditionalOptions: Additional Options, if applicable, will be shown here.
Edit.SaveButton: Select the Save button to save your changes and return to the Production Group Management screen.
Edit.CancelButton: Select the Cancel button to cancel <u>without saving your changes</u> and return to the Production Group Management screen.

Columns.Overview: Existing Production Groups are listed here. Select a row to select a Production Group. Selecting the top check mark will select or de-select all Production Groups in the list. Selecting a column heading will reorder the list according to that column. Selecting the heading again will reverse the previous order.
Columns.Name: Production Groups are listed here.
Columns.MachineGroups: Machine Groups within each Production Group are listed here.

Change.CancelButton: Select the Cancel button to cancel <u>without saving your changes</u> and return to the Machine Production screen.
Change.ProductionGroups: Select the desired Production Group, then select the Save button to save your changes. After a moment, The new Production Group will be shown at the top of the screen.
Change.Overview: Change the currently assigned Production Group here. The current Production Group is shown at the top of the screen.
Change.SaveButton: Select the Save button to save your changes. In the left-hand menu, select Operations, then Machine Production to return to the Machine Production screen.

Intro.CleanCut: Select the Clean Cut button to have the Machine perform a clean cut on the corrugate.
Intro.Overview: Manage your Packsize track-based Machines from this screen.
Intro.PausePlay: Select this button to pause the Machine. Select it again to return to play mode.
Intro.RollBackward: Select the Roll Backward button to have the Machine roll the corrugate backward.
Intro.RollForward: Select the Roll Forward button to have the Machine roll the corrugate forward.

Intro.Overview: Manage your Pick Zones from this screen. Pick Zones are areas within a packaging flow where specific items or groups of items are located.
Intro.NewButton: Select the New button to create a new Pick Zone.
Intro.DeleteButton: Select a Pick Zone from the list, then select the Delete button to delete it. <u>Warning! Your selection will be immediately deleted!</u>
Intro.EditButton: Select a Pick Zone from the list, then select the Edit button to edit it.

Edit.Overview: Create/edit a Pick Zone from this screen.
Edit.Name: Enter/edit the Pick Zone Name.
Edit.SaveButton: Select the Save button to save your changes and return to the Pick Zone Management screen.
Edit.CancelButton: Select the Cancel button to cancel <u>without saving your changes</u> and return to the Pick Zone Management screen.

Columns.Overview: Existing Pick Zones are listed here. Select a row to select a Pick Zone. Selecting the top check mark will select or de-select all Pick Zones in the list. Selecting a column heading will reorder the list according to that column. Selecting the heading again will reverse the previous order.
Columns.Name: Pick Zone Names are listed here.

Edit.TrackInstances: TrackInstances - Tracks only the entry and exit of a workflow. Not helpful for debugging.
Edit.TrackWithoutArguments: TrackWithoutArguments (Default) - Gets all tracking records without arguments and variables.
Edit.TrackEverything: TrackEverything - Logs fill up fast and you will see a performance hit.

GeneralTab.Overview: Manage your General and File Import server settings from the two tabs on this screen.
GeneralTab.GeneralTab: Select the General tab to set/verify general server settings.
GeneralTab.FileImportTab: Select the File Import tab to set/verify file import server settings.
GeneralTab.CallbackIpOrDnsName: Enter/edit the Callback IP address here.
GeneralTab.LoginExpireTime: Select/enter the time (in seconds) before a login expires here.
GeneralTab.WorkflowTrackingLevel: Select the desired Workflow Tracking Level from the drop-down menu.
GeneralTab.SaveButton: Select the Save button to save your changes. Because you are changing server settings, the system will automatically log you out after your changes are saved. When you log back in, your new server settings will be applied.
GeneralTab.CancelButton: Select the Cancel button to cancel <u>without saving your changes</u>. Because you are on the server settings screen, cancelling will take you back to the Admin Dashboard screen.

FileImportTab.Overview: Manage your File Import server settings from this screen.
FileImportTab.DefaultImportType: Select the default type of imported files from the drop-down menu.
FileImportTab.MonitoredFolderPath: Enter/edit the folder name the system will monitor for file imports. The default is DropFolder.
FileImportTab.FileExtension: Enter/edit the file extension the system will monitor for imported files. The default is csv.
FileImportTab.TimesToRetryAccessFilePath: Select/enter the number of times the system should attempt to access the monitored folder if an attempt fails.
FileImportTab.SecondsToRetryToAccessMonitoredFilePath: Select/enter the amount of time (in seconds) the system should wait between attempts to access the monitored folder.
FileImportTab.TimesToRetryLockedFile: Select/enter the number of times the system should attempt to access the imported file if the file is locked and can't be opened.
FileImportTab.SecondsToRetryLockedFile: Select/enter the amount of time (in seconds) the system should wait between attempts to open the locked file.
FileImportTab.FieldDelimiter: Enter/edit the default field delimiter used by the system with imported files. The default is a semi-colon (;).
FileImportTab.CommentIndicator: Enter/edit the default comment indicator used by the system with imported files. The default is a tilde (~).
FileImportTab.HeaderFields: If desired, you can add a header field to imported files. This is optional. The default is blank.
FileImportTab.DeleteImportedFiles: Select this checkbox to delete imported files after they are processed by the system.
FileImportTab.SaveButton: Select the Save button to save your changes. Because you are changing server settings, the system will automatically log you out after your changes are saved. When you log back in, your new server settings will be applied.
FileImportTab.CancelButton: Select the Cancel button to cancel <u>without saving your changes</u>. Because you are on the server settings screen, cancelling will take you back to the Admin Dashboard screen.

Intro.Overview: Manage your Users from this screen.
Intro.NewButton: Select the New button to create a new User.
Intro.DeleteButton: Select a User from the list, then select the Delete button to delete them. <u>Warning! Your selection will be immediately deleted!</u>
Intro.EditButton: Select a User from the list, then select the Edit button to edit them.

Edit.Overview: Create/edit a User from this screen.
Edit.Username: Enter the Username. If you are editing an existing User, the Username cannot be changed.
Edit.PasswordSecondCheck: For verification purposes, enter/edit the Password again.
Edit.AutoLoginUser: Select this checkbox to designate a User as an Auto Login User. This means they will be automatically logged in when the system boots. This setting is useful when the same user works on the same machine each day. For security reasons, a User can either log in automatically or be set as an administrator, but not both.
Edit.Administrator: Select this checkbox to designate a User as an Administrator. This allows the User to change settings, add/remove other Users, and perform other administrative functions. For security reasons, a User can either be set as an administrator or to log in automatically, but not both.
Edit.SaveButton: Select the Save button to save your changes and return to the User Management screen.
Edit.CancelButton: Select the Cancel button to cancel <u>without saving your changes</u> and return to the User Management screen.

Columns.Overview: Existing Users are listed here. Select a row to select a User. Selecting the top check mark will select or de-select all Users in the list. Selecting a column heading will reorder the list according to that column. Selecting the heading again will reverse the previous order.

Sent.Overview: Jobs that have been sent to be produced are listed here.

CreateFromArticle.CancelButton: Select the Cancel button to cancel <u>without creating any jobs</u> and return to the Machine Production screen.
CreateFromArticle.CreateButton: Select the Create button to create a job based on an Article.
CreateFromArticle.FilterButton: Select the Filter button to display the filter box, then enter the filtering value. The list will be filtered immediately based on your criteria. Select the Filter button again to close the filter box. <u>The list will remain filtered (even if the filter box isn't visible) until the filtering value is removed from the filter box.</u>
CreateFromArticle.Overview: Create jobs based on Articles here.
CreateFromArticle.Quantity: Select/edit the quantity for this Article-based job.

Custom.CancelButton: Select the Cancel button to cancel <u>without creating any custom jobs</u> and return to the Machine Production screen.
Custom.Design: Select the carton Design from the drop-down menu.
Custom.Overview: Create a custom job for the current Machine Group here.
Custom.ProduceButton: Select the Produce button to produce this custom job.
Custom.Quantity: Select/enter the Quantity for this custom job.
Custom.Preview: Preview of carton design and layout

CustomJob.Title: Create Custom Job For Machine Group '{{ currentMachineAlias }}'
CustomJob.CorrugateQualityMustBeNum: Corrugate Quality Must Be A Whole Number

Closed.Filter: Enter a value here to filter the Closed Orders list. The list will immediately display the filtered results.
Closed.Overview: Closed Orders (orders that have been produced) are listed here.
Closed.SortBy: To sort the Closed Orders list, select Sort By, then select an available option. The Closed Orders list will immediately re-sort according to the option chosen.

Open.Cancel: Select an Open Order from the list, then select the Cancel Orders button to cancel it.
Open.CreateNext: Select the Create Next button to produce the next order in the Open Order list.
Open.Filter: Enter a value here to filter the Open Orders list. The list will immediately display the filtered results.
Open.Overview: Open Orders (orders waiting to be produced) are listed here.

ScanToCreate.BarcodeData: Enter/scan the barcode data. Acceptable formats are: '<Design ID>:<Length>:<Width>:<Height>' or '<Design ID>:<Length>:<Width>:<Height>:<Quantity>'.
ScanToCreate.TriggerData: Select the Trigger Data button to produce the job using the barcode data.

Common.AdditionalOptions: Select the <u>Show/Hide Additional Search Options</u> link to show/hide additional search parameters.
Common.Article: Select a specific Article ID from the drop-down menu as part of your search criteria or leave it as the default (All).
Common.CartonHeight: If desired, enter a carton Height as part of your search criteria.
Common.CartonLength: If desired, enter a carton Length as part of your search criteria.
Common.CartonWidth: If desired, enter a carton Width as part of your search criteria.
Common.Corrugate: Select a specific corrugate Name from the drop-down menu as part of your search criteria or leave it as the default (All).
Common.CorrugateQuality: Select/enter a specific corrugate Quality from the drop-down menu as part of your search criteria or leave it as the default (0).
Common.CustomerId: If desired, enter a Customer ID as part of your search criteria.
Common.DateBegin: Enter a beginning date for your search. This defines the earliest created date/time to be shown in your search results.
Common.DateEnd: Enter an ending date for your search. This defines the last created date/time to be shown in your search results.
Common.Design: Select a specific Design from the drop-down menu as part of your search criteria or leave it as the default (All).
Common.Machine: Select a specific Produced By Machine from the drop-down menu as part of your search criteria or leave it as the default (All).
Common.MachineGroup: Select a specific Machine Group from the drop-down menu as part of your search criteria or leave it as the default (All).
Common.Reproduce: Select an item from the Search Results list, then select the Reproduce button to produce it again.
Common.ResultsFilter: Select this button to enable/disable the result filtering of the list.
Common.Search: After entering the desired criteria in the search fields, select the Search button to search the database. Your search results will appear in the grid.
Common.Status: Select a specific Status from the drop-down menu as part of your search criteria or leave it as the default (All).
Common.Overview: Use this screen to search for a particular job. After defining the search criteria, select the Search button. Search results will be displayed in the grid.

Columns.Overview: Search results are listed in the grid. Select a row to select an item. Selecting the top check mark will select or de-select all items in the list. Selecting a column heading will reorder the list according to that column. Selecting the heading again will reverse the previous order.
Columns.ExpandableRow: If an item is part of a kit, select this row to see which types of producible items are included.
Columns.ProducedOn: Machine Groups that produced job listed here.
Columns.ProducibleInfo: Information about the producible listed here.
Columns.Trigger: The timestamp (date and time when an item was triggered) is listed here.

BoxFirst.CartonPropertyGroup: Select a specific Carton Property Group from the drop-down menu as part of your search criteria or leave it as the default (All).
BoxFirst.Classification: Select a specific Classification from the drop-down menu as part of your search criteria or leave it as the default (All).
BoxFirst.PickZone: Select a specific Pick Zone from the drop-down menu as part of your search criteria or leave it as the default (All).

BoxLast.Barcode: Enter a Barcode as part of your search criteria.

Intro.Barcode: If desired, enter a Barcode as part of your search criteria.

Columns.Barcode: Barcode used to create this producible is listed here.

Columns.ProduceOnTarget: Specifies the production group or machine group that will produce this Order.
Columns.ProducedOn: Machine Group that last produced this Order.

MachineEmergencyStop.StepsToResolve: Reset all Emergency Stop switches, then press Play.

ErrorCodes.7215: At Least One Phase Of The Power Line Failed
ErrorCodes.29215: Discrete Movement Not Possible Due To Drive Errors

ErrorCodes.7215: At Least One Phase Of The Power Line Failed
ErrorCodes.29215: Discrete Movement Not Possible Due To Drive Errors

PacksizePackagingMachineErrorPaperJam.StepsToResolve: Clean the jammed Corrugate from the Feed Roller.

PacksizePackagingMachineErrorLongHeadQua.StepsToResolve: Correct the Longhead quantity mismatch by either adding or removing Longheads from the machine or by changing the Physical Machine Settings file.

PacksizePackagingMachineErrorTrackQuanti.AdditionalInfo: Expected {1} Tracks, Found {0} Tracks. Expected {2} Sensor Pulses, Found {3} Sensor Pulses.
PacksizePackagingMachineErrorTrackQuanti.StepsToResolve: Verify the Track Sensor is working correctly or alter the number of tracks listed for this Machine.

PacksizePackagingMachineErrorAirPressure.StepsToResolve: Verify the integrity of the pneumatics on the Machine, then clear the error.

MovablePressureRoller.StepsToResolve: Adjust the movable Pressure Roller to the correct location, depending on whether this is a single-track or multi-track Machine.

PacksizePackagingMachineErrorReferenceQu.AdditionalInfo: Expected {0} reference points, found {1} reference points
PacksizePackagingMachineErrorReferenceQu.StepsToResolve: Verify the reference quantity on this Machine and in the Physical Machine Settings file is the same.

MachineAlreadyConnectedError.StepsToResolve: This Machine appears to already be connected. This error may occur if you have another instance of PackNet.Server running. Please close any other instances of PackNet.Server before connecting to a Machine from this instance of the software.

ZebraErrorUnableToPause.StepsToResolve: Verify that the printer is in a good state.

OutOfLabels.StepsToResolve: Refill the printer with new labels.

UnexpectedLabelOnPrinter.StepsToResolve: Remove the label from the printer.

UserPreferences.Title: Preferences
UserPreferences.LogMessagesToKeep: Number of log messages to keep:
